intro: Hicorius leiodermis, commonly known as the smooth-skin hibiscus, is a flowering plant belonging to the Malvaceae family. It is characterized by its large, showy flowers that typically range in color from pink to red. The plant has smooth, waxy leaves that are often arranged alternately along the stem. It thrives in tropical and subtropical climates, preferring well-drained soil and full sunlight. Hicorius leiodermis is often cultivated for its ornamental value in gardens and landscapes.
